citations.narrative:
In the indoor portion of the facility a female skunk had escaped the skunk enclosure and was found hiding beneath the
Opossum enclosure. Animals that escape the safety of their enclosure are at risk of injury or illness. Enclosures must be
of sturdy construction, maintained in good repair, and must safely contain the animals.
Corrected at time of inspection.
The Chinchilla enclosure has several exposed sharp points because the animals are chewing the wooden perches. The
facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and
outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury.
To be corrected by 4-30-2025.

The enclosure housing 27 Parakeets and 2 Cockatiel has a wooden back panel that is separated from the wall creating a
large open space. A hole is observed in the roof of the enclosure in the back corner near the air vent.
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. The
primary enclosures must be kept in good repair.
To be corrected by 4-30-2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There appears to be a lack of adequate pest control procedures at the facility. Three live mice were observed on the
ground along the back side of the Macaw enclosure. The licensee must create and maintain an effective program for the
control of pests to promote the health and comfort of the animals.
To be corrected by 4-30-2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
In the indoor portion of the facility a female skunk had escaped the skunk enclosure and was found hiding beneath the 
Opossum enclosure. Animals that escape the safety of their enclosure are at risk of injury or illness. Enclosures must be 
of sturdy construction, maintained in good repair, and must safely contain the animals. 
Corrected at time of inspection. 
 
The Chinchilla enclosure has several exposed sharp points because the animals are chewing the wooden perches. The 
facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and 
outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from 
injury.  
To be corrected by 4-30-2025. 
3.153(a) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The enclosure housing 27 Parakeets and 2 Cockatiel has a wooden back panel that is separated from the wall creating a 
large open space. A hole is observed in the roof of the enclosure in the back corner near the air vent. 
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. The 
primary enclosures must be kept in good repair.  
To be corrected by 4-30-2025. 
3.158(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
There appears to be a lack of adequate pest control procedures at the facility. Three live mice were observed on the 
ground along the back side of the Macaw enclosure. The licensee must create and maintain an effective program for the 
control of pests to promote the health and comfort of the animals. 
To be corrected by 4-30-2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
